job_details.Functieomschrijving:
As a developer, you will find some great things at LessonUp. Apart from a mission-driven team that is ready to make a change, you will work on something that is being used on a daily basis by thousands (200K+ users!) of people. Not just in the Netherlands, but on a global level. 50% of our team is focused on product & tech. We also highly value your personal development. Apart from the learning curve you will get from working in our team and amongst other high-quality professionals, we will set up a personal development plan and will offer you time and education, based on your personal learning goals.

   But most of all, our team will make you feel welcome and at home. LessonUp style. :)

   What you'll be doing:
     * Write clean, high-performance code used by thousands of teachers and students, ensuring it works well for everyone.
     * Work closely with different cross-functional teams to smoothly add new features and improvements to our software.
     * Look for ways to make our solutions work well as more people use them and as technology changes.
     * Take responsibility for making sure our team's solutions are really good, from start to finish.
     * Try out new tools and technologies to make our software better, and help add new things to what we already use.
     * Help newer developers learn and grow by showing them the ropes and sharing what you know.

   Technologies and concepts we use:

   We're not expecting you to be an expert in all the technologies we use, but we'd love it if you're familiar and comfortable with most of them.
     * Typescript
     * NodeJS
     * GraphQL
     * MongoDB
     * Redis
     * RabbitMQ
     * ElasticSearch
     * Kubernetes (GKE)
     * OpenAI & LLM
     * GitOps with ArgoCD and Terraform
     * Google Cloud Platform
job_details.full_text:
Senior Software Engineer Backend

As a developer, you will find some great things at LessonUp. Apart from a mission-driven team that is ready to make a change, you will work on something that is being used on a daily basis by thousands (200K+ users!) of people. Not just in the Netherlands, but on a global level. 50% of our team is focused on product & tech. We also highly value your personal development. Apart from the learning curve you will get from working in our team and amongst other high-quality professionals, we will set up a personal development plan and will offer you time and education, based on your personal learning goals.

   But most of all, our team will make you feel welcome and at home. LessonUp style. :)

   What you'll be doing:
     * Write clean, high-performance code used by thousands of teachers and students, ensuring it works well for everyone.
     * Work closely with different cross-functional teams to smoothly add new features and improvements to our software.
     * Look for ways to make our solutions work well as more people use them and as technology changes.
     * Take responsibility for making sure our team's solutions are really good, from start to finish.
     * Try out new tools and technologies to make our software better, and help add new things to what we already use.
     * Help newer developers learn and grow by showing them the ropes and sharing what you know.

   Technologies and concepts we use:

   We're not expecting you to be an expert in all the technologies we use, but we'd love it if you're familiar and comfortable with most of them.
     * Typescript
     * NodeJS
     * GraphQL
     * MongoDB
     * Redis
     * RabbitMQ
     * ElasticSearch
     * Kubernetes (GKE)
     * OpenAI & LLM
     * GitOps with ArgoCD and Terraform
     * Google Cloud Platform

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on traditional backend software engineering tasks, emphasizing code quality, feature development, scalability, and team collaboration. While it mentions 'OpenAI & LLM' and 'Google Cloud Platform', these are listed as technologies the candidate might be familiar with, rather than core responsibilities. The primary focus is on building and improving software, not on developing, fine-tuning, or deploying generative AI models or predictive ML systems. Therefore, it does not align with the core responsibilities of an ML Engineer or a GenAI Engineer.
